snippet: American Jews often view the coming-of-age ceremony not as an entry to Jewish life, but as a graduation ceremony. A new initiative by the Reform movement is out to change that.
abstract: Leaders in nation's largest branch of Judaism, Reform movement, start initiative to rethink the bar and bat mitzvah, coming of age ceremony that many American Jews consider a sort of graduation ceremony rather than an entry to Jewish life; movement aims to have parents play a larger role in spiritual guidance and shifts emphasis from prayer to social action.
lead_paragraph: American Jews often view the coming-of-age ceremony not as an entry to Jewish life, but as a graduation ceremony. A new initiative by the Reform movement is out to change that.

headline.main: Bar Mitzvahs Get New Look to Build Faith
headline.print_headline: Bar Mitzvahs Get New Look To Build Faith
